alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Franklin and southwestern Hart Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carnesville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carnesville, Hartwell, Royston, Lavonia, Canon, Franklin Springs, Bowersville, Victoria Bryant State Park, Martin and Vanna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
